dialogues.text: Do you delight in reminding me? Yes, Knight, I long for death...but fear it.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Why? Aside from your misery, what's to lose?

dialogues.speaker: DRAGON
dialogues.text: My soul. The two disappear over a dip in the road.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Einon's castle looks even more forbidding at night. RAUCO LAUGHTER ECHOES from within its towering walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ROASTED PIG twirls on a spit over an open fire. SERVANT with food and drink, hustle about to serve... EINON & HIS KNIGHTS...and THEIR ROWDY WOMENFOLK, dining alfresco by torchlight. Einon sits at the head of a huge BANQUET TABLE, drunkenly laughing as he watches...  48 SIR BROK...bare-chested, atop the table, wrestle TWO MEN once. Brok tosses one over his shoulder and off the table into the bonfire. With a yelp, the wrestler rolls on the ground and servants obliging beat the flames off him. The lords and their "ladies" roar with approval and urge on. Brok slings his opponent down the length of the table sending food and crockery flying. The wrestler slides pas the howling, drunken crowd to the end of the table where head flops over the edge as he groans and passes out, his rolled eyes blaring vacantly up at... AISLINN...primly seated at the table end, the only point stillness in this rowdy revelry. Weary despair, not age, faded her beauty. Einon shouts down the table at her.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: Can he continue, Mother? Aislinn lifts the unconscious man's arm off her plate by sleeve in dainty disgust, dropping it contemptuously over edge of the table.

dialogues.speaker: AISLINN
dialogues.text: The field is Sir Brok's, my son. Brok does a victory dance on the table to the delighted r of the crowd, while Einon spins to Felton beside him. Nestled drunkenly in Felton's arms is his PRETTY LITTLE M Purses and STACKS OF COINS litter the table. Einon scoops two stacks from Felton's pile to his.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: Twenty you owe me, Felton! Felton starts to feebly protest.

dialogues.speaker: AISLINN
dialogues.text: Ten...my son. The correction is spoken in flat calm. Einon frowns at hi mother, then at Felton whose Pretty Little Minx has start to slide one of the stacks back. Felton smiles uneasily a the displeased king and, slapping away Minx's hand from t coins, scoots them back to Einon's pile.

dialogues.speaker: FELTON
dialogues.text: The spectacle of Sir Brok's prowess is worth double the wager, sire! Einon, reeling up, snatches a PITCHER to pour more wine. It's empty. He bangs it on the table.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: More wine!  49 Suddenly, in the polished sheen of the pitcher's metal, E catches something.

dialogues.speaker: THE PITCHER
dialogues.text: Reflected in the pitcher, he sees a FIGURE, ARMED WITH A

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: As Einon once more bangs the pitcher on the table.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: Wine! The King's thirst must be quenched! Suddenly, from off the rooftop THE FIGURE comes flying. B Einon's timing is perfect. He ducks and the attacker goes flying over him, sprawling onto the table amid the feast screams of the stunned women. Einon is atop the body in a instant, spinning it over, and wrenching the knife from t grasp of... KARA...who struggles in Einon's grasp, her red hair flyin A half-dozen swords fly out, ready to stab her to death.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: No! The blades stop. Einon's sobering gaze intently scrutiniz the girl. About her neck, she wears her father's headband Once more her flame hair glows against the fire-light jar an elusive memory for Einon.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: I know...you... (recognition hits) The quarry! The blind dog's whelp! (laughs) Family devotion! A fine thing! Isn't it, mother? Only Aislinn's sad eyes respond to his sneering question. accusation, they are filled with quiet admiration for the girl. Einon turns his sneer on Kara once more.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: First you beg mercy for his fate. Then try to avenge it. And now you'll share it. But it's said with fleeing conviction, even as Einon's sn flees...for he's become aware of her beauty.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: In your kingdom, Einon, there are worse fates than death.  50 The sneer is back.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: Itll think up one for you! Lock her up! Brok and others haul her away. Einon picks up the dagger then gazes at his mother, watching him in inscrutable silence.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: Where's my wine! He jabs the dagger into a hunk of meat and tears off a bi with his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kara's dagger furiously chops at a wooden branch. CAMERA BACK on Einon, dressed in an open jerkin, on the battleme amid the work rubble of renovation. Einon idly chops at a piece of scaffolding with Kara's kn mesmerized by the glow of... THE FORGE...fiery hot. Sweaty bodies toil over it, hammer out hinges and bars. Other workers scuttle about, banging and sawing in counterpoint to... EINON'S VIOLENT WHITTLING...As he watches, the noise seem get louder in his head, swirling and jarring, TRANSFORMIN INTO OTHER SOUNDS...SOUNDS OF BATTLE...clanking metal and clashing arms! Suddenly, Einon's eyes spark with ferociou light. He charges down a stairway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Einon flies down a flight of stone steps.

dialogues.speaker: EINON'S CASTLE
dialogues.text: Einon stalks through the courtyard with determined purpos bolting into a grated doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Einon barges into the dungeon, startling Kara, chained to wall. His intense gaze is unnerving. He idly strokes his chest with the knife. As he presses into her, he slides t blade from the folds of his shirt and caresses her throat with it.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: I remember now...  51 He rips open her blouse with the dagger. She gasps as he slides the blade along her chest. Over her jerking heart. He flips aside the torn flaps of the garment to peer at h breasts.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: XY remember...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kara, in a simple shift, lies amidst the rumpled coverlet a bed. The unspilt tears in her eyes glisten in the candl glow of a nearby sconce. Einon sits on the edge of the bed, his jerkin open and lo ‘He sneers in amused contempt as her first tear falls.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: (drunkenly) You weep? You could be on the battle- ments as buzzard bait rather than in the royal bed. Rebels must learn to love their king. He lurches up and weaves to the nightstand where he refil his wine cup. Kara spies his discarded belt on the floor +--and her dagger tucked in jit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dagger plunges down...against a flint. CAMERA BACK. Bow and the Dragon camp in a canyon. A plucked bird is skewer ona spit. Bowen tries to start a fire with a flint. The Dragon watches in amusement. Flame snorts from his nostri and the campfire's ablaze. So's the bird. Bowen nods a dubious thanks as the Dragon wipes the black rings from h nostrils with a sniff.

dialogues.speaker: DRAGON
dialogues.text: Hope you like it well done. Bowen jerks the spit from the fire, beats the flames off bird, and eats. Firelight flickers over the shiny horns o Bowen's shield. Bowen notices the Dragon staring at them.

dialogues.speaker: DRAGON
dialogues.text: Did you hate us so much?

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: I hated one of you. (refers to shield) These I killed, because I wanted to kill him. But never found him. Never shall. If you are the last, he must be dead.  52

dialogues.speaker: DRAGON
dialogues.text: Yes..What was he like? This Dragon you hated.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: He had only half a heart. But even one half held enough evil to pollute an innocent. Dragon, forgetting himself, rises up, hotly.

dialogues.speaker: DRAGON
dialogues.text: Einon was no innocent! He polluted the heart! Now Bowen rises. The pair stare wildly at each other...Bo surprised the Dragon knows this history...The Dragon worr he might have tipped his hand.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: So you know the story, Dragon?

dialogues.speaker: DRAGON
dialogues.text: All Dragons knew it! What was to be their hope became their doom. A spoiled, ungrateful child was given a great gift and destroyed it! The words cut through Bowen, prodding the suspicion he ha always held...and never wanted to confront.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: No! I knew that boy. Taught hin. Taught him the ways of honour and right. The Old Code.

dialogues.speaker: DRAGON
dialogues.text: Then he betrayed you, even as he betrayed the dragon whose heart he broke!

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: That's a lie, Dragon!

dialogues.speaker: DRAGON
dialogues.text: Stop calling me dragon! I have a name!

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: What is it then, Dragon? This breaks the tension. The Dragon shrugs sheepishly.

dialogues.speaker: DRAGON
dialogues.text: Well...uh...you couldn't possibly pronounce it in your tongue.  53 Bowen turns away in exasperated disgust, flinging his bir into the fire. Behind him the Dragon suddenly clutches at his shoulder and staggers in pain. A RED GLOW PULSATES

dialogues.speaker: DRAGON
dialogues.text: Arr...er...awwrr.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: You're right. I couldn't pronounce it... Again, the Dragon moans and Bowen realizes he wasn't gett a language lesson. This language is universal -- PAIN! He wheels to see the Dragon fall, wincing to the ground. ‘INT. EINON'S CASTLE - BEDCHAMBER - ON WINE CUP - NIGHT Einon's wine cup rolls on the floor, the wine seeping acr the stones like blood. CAMERA UP. Einon, a startled glaze in his eyes, slumps against the wall. HIS DAGGER is burie hilt deep in his left shoulder. Kara glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: A love dart from Cupid, Einon! Einon jerks up, wrenching the blade from his jerkin sleev which he cuts open, exposing the wound...A thin line of b trickles from his shoulder, but the wound is surprisingly slight. Einon laughs, wiping at the blood and sucking it from his finger.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: Not as deep or deadly as you thought? Next time stab more flesh, less cloth.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Next time I'll pierce your heart! He grabs her arm and throws her on the bed, hovering over her, pulling close.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: You already did, sweet, in more ways than one. A very special heart. Like no other. He places her hand against his chest. She yanks it back.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: A black withered thing devoid of pity. Einon brings the knife to her throat. But as he gazes at lovely face twisted in hate for him, he calms, caressing with the dagger, wiping his blood on her cheek. In his ey is a pathetic perverse look of pain.  54

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: Then teach me. Pity me... Everything. I would give you everything. Even power. You are so...beautiful. Knife still against her cheek, he kisses her reluctant li in awkward tenderness. As she pulls back, he shoves her o the bed and sticks the knife in the bedpost. Kara glares and sees... HIS WOUND...is almost ENTIRELY HEALED. As though she only scratched him!

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: Even power...even a throne... ‘He staggers drunkenly from the room. Kara fights back fr tears, her hands scraping down her body as though trying rub his foul touch from her. In manic fury, she rips the covers from the bed, then collapses on it, tears flooding

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Firelight reflects across his face as... BOWEN...concern etched in his face, uses a wet saddle bla as a compress for the Dragon's shoulder, still glowing ho STEAM puffs up in a SIZZLING HISS as Bowen places the bla over the wound and the glow subsides.

dialogues.speaker: DRAGON
dialogues.text: Thank you. It's passed now.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: What was it?

dialogues.speaker: DRAGON
dialogues.text: An old complaint that acts up now and again...

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Forgive me if anything I said...If I upset you...

dialogues.speaker: DRAGON
dialogues.text: It wasn't you...not you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kara fitfully sleeps. A SHADOW falls over her. She stirs a hand pulls the dagger from the bedpost. She jerks up, cowering. Aislinn steps into the candlelight.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: How did you come here?

dialogues.speaker: AISLINN
dialogues.text: T have my ways.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Why did you come?

dialogues.speaker: AISLINN
dialogues.text: To help.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: I need no help from her who bore the beast.

dialogues.speaker: AISLINN
dialogues.text: I bore a child...An innocent child. Was it his fault he was the bitter fruit of a seed sown without love?

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: I would have smothered such a child in his crib.

dialogues.speaker: AISLINN
dialogues.text: You say so now. I thought so once. But when you hold him in your arms, you do not see the monster he can become...Only a small something that is a part of you, erying for your nourishment, frail and helpless... And you do not realize you are the helpless one. (bitter outburst) How could I guide him when I was merely a bit of plunder? A creature of submission. Allowed no pleasure. No feelings. No voice. How could he hear me? What was left for him but his father's taint? Aislinn, trembling with emotion, regains her regal compos

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Is this the help you offer? To foretell my future in your past? Give me the dagger. Let me kill myself before I am accomplice to this vile legacy.

dialogues.speaker: AISLINN
dialogues.text: Why wish for death, when there is freedom? The Queen takes a candle and goes to a corner of the cham illuminating a stone wall. She presses a hidden spring an the wall creaks open, exposing a secret passage.  56

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stone wall slides open and Kara and Aislinn step out in large CISTERN. Below them is the water. Aislinn leads Kar down a stone path that runs along the wall of the cistern Kara sees the door on the other side and starts to open i but Aislinn stops her, sliding open a small hatch in the door. Through the peephole, Kara can see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: «.+.The guards patrolling the courtyard.

dialogues.speaker: -INT. EINON'S CASTLE
dialogues.text: Aislinn points to an iron door, just above the water's surface. Kara heads for it, stopping before it to turn ba

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Thank y... But Aislinn has disappeared once more into the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kara stealthily emerges from a crevice of the castle wall rocky foundation and slides down a steep pass into the darkness of the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cape around his shoulders, nodding off to sleep. As his head slumps forward, he jerks it back, popping his eyes o

dialogues.speaker: DRAGON, (0S)
dialogues.text: Have you been watching over me all night? CAMERA BACK. The Dragon is curled on the ground behind Bowen, who has indeed been holding vigil, though he's embarrassed by it.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: I've...been thinking...

dialogues.speaker: DRAGON
dialogues.text: About what...?

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Many things...Mostly what to call you. I've found you a name.

dialogues.speaker: DRAGON
dialogues.text: 57 You say that as though you reached up and plucked it from the sky.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: I did. Up there. See that cluster of stars there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SERIES OF STARS shine brilliantly against night's black curtain. It is the CONSTELLATION OF DRACO. (NOTE: The radiance of these stars should be highly exaggerated to make the pattern of the constellation plai visible.) The Dragon's head looms into frame, staring at the stars.

dialogues.speaker: DRAGON
dialogues.text: I know those stars very well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Dragon gazes up at the stars in fervent longing.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Do you see the shape they make?

dialogues.speaker: DRAGON
dialogues.text: A dragon.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Yes. We call it DRACO. It means dragon in the scholar's speech.

dialogues.speaker: DRAGON
dialogues.text: So instead of calling me Dragon in your tongue, you'll call me Dragon in some other tongue.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: You're right. It's a silly idea.

dialogues.speaker: DRAGON
dialogues.text: No...I would be honoured to be named after those stars. Draco. Thank you, Kni...Do you have a name?

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Bowen.

dialogues.speaker: . DRAGON
dialogues.text: Thank you, Bowen. DRACO looks skyward at his namesake.

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: ...Draco... The serpentine constellation glows in the night sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRASHING & YELLING echoes from within the forbidding edif

dialogues.speaker: EINON, (0S)
dialogues.text: Dogs! Fools! INT. BEDCHAMBER ~ EINON'S CASTLE -— NIGHT ‘A GUARD flies across the room, clattering into a table a chairs. ANOTHER GUARD staggers out of the debris of overturned bedding and a nightstand. An enraged Einon gra him by the neck and flings him into the open fireplace. A nervous Brok and an inscrutable Aislinn watch Einon's lethal tantrum as the guard rolls yelping out of the fire Einon descends on him with the IRON FIREPLACE POKER, repeatedly beating the man on the back and legs.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: If you can't guard a simple girl, then go guard shades in Hell. Brok intercedes with wary caution.

dialogues.speaker: BROK
dialogues.text: Sire! How could they have known of that? Wild with fury, spittle flecking his lips, he spins on Br pressing the tip of the poker against the Knight's throat though he'd plunge through the other side. Brok points to the open secret passage. Einon turns to it, his rage subsiding slightly as he's struck by a thought.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: More importantly, how could the girl know? His dark gaze shifts to his mother as he lowers the poker from Brok's throat. He kicks the guard at his feet and flings the poker at the other.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: Get out! The guards scurry out the door. Einon, still staring at h mother, issues a command to Brok.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: Get my best men!  59 Brok bows and exits. Aislinn cooly returns Einon's gaze.

dialogues.speaker: AISLINN
dialogues.text: I'll send someone to clean up this mess. She exits. Einon suspiciously watches her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BARRAGE OF VEGETABLES COMES FLYING AT THE CAMERA, which

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN ANGRY MOB...pursuing A DISHEVELLED YOUNG WOMAN through village, pelting her with rotten vegetables and handfuls mud. Shouting above the crowd, the girl futilely tries to -hold her ground. Underneath the mud, splattered produce, grungy clothes, it's KARA!

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Throw off the yoke of Einon's oppression. Raise arms, I say! SPLOTCH! A ROTTEN CABBAGE plows into her chest. SPLAT! A GLOP OF MUD smacks her forehead.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Listen to me! WHACK! MORE MUD sprays across her. A strapping blacksmith HEWE, sporting an EYEPATCH, has thrown it.

dialogues.speaker: HEWE
dialogues.text: To treason! Your father sang that sour tune once, Kara. (points to his eye) And once was enough. We'll not dance to it again!

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: No, just cringe like dogs under Einon's boot.

dialogues.speaker: HEWE
dialogues.text: A cringing dog's a live one! Hewe rears back to toss a SQUASH, but ANOTHER HAND plucks from his grasp. The peasant angrily wheels about to confront... BOWEN...breaking the squash in half and biting into a pie Kara remembers him instantly and a smile of recognition breaks through the veil of dripping vegetables.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Why waste good food on bad rhetoric? Kara's smile disappears as she snarls in umbrage.  60

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: I speak truth!

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: (munching squash) Truth is rarely inspiring, lass, and never wins rebellions. But. it can stretch rebels' necks...if there is a neck under that vegetable patch. Kara self-consciously wipes at her face. Grinning, Bowen, offers her the other squash half. She indignantly shoves in his face. The crowd laughs then... A WOMAN SCREAMS...and points skyward...A WIND rustles thr the village as the crowd dives for cover. Bowen wipes the ‘squash from his eyes just in time to see: DRACO'S WING...dip past, knocking a PATCH OF THATCH off a roof. It plops on... BOWEN...who falls to the ground underneath it. He comes u spewing thatch and glaring skyward, mumbling to himself.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Show-off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Draco, smoke curling from his nostrils, perches on a rock ledge overhanging a GROVE OF TREES a short distance from village like a vulture, hungrily eying... THE VILLAGERS...huddling behind their hut. Hewe dickers w a peeved Bowen, still picking thatch out of his clothes.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Where's the Lord responsible for this village?

dialogues.speaker: HEWE
dialogues.text: In a fine house six miles away. He'll just blame any destruction on us and pluck our pockets to pay for it. This remark nettles Bowen's latent conscience but not eno to dissuade him.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Well, I won't pluck them as deeply! It was a fair offer, take it or leave..-him! (points to Draco) The villagers mumble among themselves as Kara shoves thro the crowd, dripping mud and mushy vegetables in her wake.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: 61 (points to Bowen) Leave him! It's bad enough you grovel to Einon. Will you be bullied by some blackmailing broken-down knight? You don't need him to get rid of a dragon! Bowen glares, caring neither for her insults nor meddling He turns to a ROTUND VILLAGER with THREE ROTUND DAUGHTERS

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: That's right. Perhaps you'll part with one of your delectable daughters instead of gold. Dragons are partial to maiden sacrifices. The Rotund Villager fans his arms in front of his daughte to protect them from such a horrid thought. But Hewe like the idea, with alterations...

dialogues.speaker: HEWE
dialogues.text: Why must it be a daughter? The crowd turns with him as his shifty gaze falls on... KARA...jaw dropping as she realizes their intent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The VILLAGERS roll a rickety CART out to an open field, t old battlefield where they fought King Freyne. Kara, strapped to a pole wedged into the back of the cart, yell her head off.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: No! No! Please! I'm not even a virgin! Bowen watches in exasperated disgust.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Superstitious yokels. He mounts up and rides out of the village.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From his perch, Draco watches the shenanigans of the villagers in utter befuddlement. Suddenly, he sees Bowen below, riding up to the base of the rock.

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: Who's the girl?

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: A nuisance. Get rid of her.  62

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: They're trying to placate you with a sacrifice.

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: Whoever gave them that bright idea?

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Never mind! They're imbeciles. DRACO. Barbarians!

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Just get rid of her!

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: How should I know? Eat her.

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: Oh please! Yecch!

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: My, aren't we squeamish? You ate Sir Eglamore.

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: I never swallowed! Merely chewed in self~defense.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Oh...then I suppose torching her's out of the question.

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: Absolutely!

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: It would impress the yokels.

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: Will you listen to yourself?

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Well...then...improvise! Draco heaves a sigh and swoops off the rock towards...  63

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KARA...who screams, Draco reaches out a claw to her whereupon she faints. Draco wrenches the stake out of the cart, flies off with the limp girl OUT OF FRAME. As the empty stake plops back down to the ground, the CRO pours out into the village, cheering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sour-faced Bowen comes riding through. Suddenly he hear TRILLING. The strange DRAGONSONG. But this time the music trill is light and happy, not melancholy as before. -Bowen spurs his horse to the sound, coming to a clearing where he spies...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KARA...sits on a rock, soaking up the sun, as Draco contentedly trills. Kara is transported, touched by the strange music. She smiles at Draco.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: You have a beautiful voice. Draco BLUSHES A BRIGHT CRIMSON. Kara laughs at his awkwar shyness.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: You're not like a dragon at all.

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: How many do you know?

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: None that serenade maidens instead of devouring them. You're entirely too happy for a dragon. I bet you don't do any of the horrid things they say.

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: Minstrels' fancies. Never hurt a soul unless they try to hurt me first.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Then why were you in that village?

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: Oh?...0h! The village!

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN, (0S)
dialogues.text: Yes! You remember the village. Both Kara and Draco turn to...  64 BOWEN...stomping toward them. Kara emits a warlike screec and leaps onto his horse. She plops in the saddle, face~t face with Bowen and starts to pummel him.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Leave him alone, you bully! Run, Draco, fly! I'll hold hin, (to Bowen) Pick on someone your own size! Draco suppresses his laughter as Bowen and Kara tumble fr the saddle in the pond. Bowen sputters at Draco.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Where have you been?

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: I've been...distracted...Bowen, meet Kara. Bowen turns to Kara and, with an exasperated sigh, grabs her floundering arm to help her up. She slaps him away. He lets go. She flops back down in the pond.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: You should have eaten her!

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: Now don't be angry.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Why not? You left me high and dry. Worried to death...

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: Worried? Over me?

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: .+-Here I am waiting around...I don't know what's happened? Where you are? When you're coming back?... Suddenly Draco tenses. All aquiver. Listening. He whirls back behind the waterfall. Kara watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: ...-If you're coming back? You just... Bowen wheels back to Draco, only to discover him gone.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: ...disappear... He glares suspiciously at Kara, as though she's hidden hi Before she can respond, Draco's head pops through the waterfall.  65

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: Horses. Someone's coming. Draco ducks back behind the falls as Bowen and Kara also the horses. Bowen turns to face them. THE RIDERS emerge from the trees. Kara recognizes them. A they, her! It's EINON with a search party. As the Riders charge up, Bowen leaps protectively in fron the frightened girl, his sword whirling in a flashy displ as Einon's minions hesitate. As they slowly surround hin, Bowen tensely holds his ground. BOOMING LAUGHTER suddenly breaks the stand-off.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: It can't be! But it is! The king's old mentor! Still giving carving lessons? Bowen sizes Einon up. He doesn't care for what he sees.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Get off your horse and I'll give you one.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: I'm bigger now. Perhaps, I'll give you one.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Stick to slaughtering peasants. It's safer.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: Oh, we don't slaughter them anymore. They can't pay their taxes if they're dead. (surveys Bowen's ragged condition) Seems times have not been kind, Bowen. You should never have broke with me.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: It was you who broke with me. Einon idly strokes his scar in dark and, perhaps, even regretful remembrance. But he shakes off old memories wit twisted smile.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: Yet you return to me and with my lost lady. Bowen turns to Kara, surprised. She shakes her head in vigorous denial.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: I think the lady wants to stay lost.  66

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: Not her choice, I'm afraid.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: My three feet of steel says it is, Kara laughs, delighted to have a defender. Einon flushes with anger. Then he slowly smiles as he unsheaths his swo

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: I'm ready for my lesson now, knight... As Bowen tenses, on guard, expecting an hounourable fight Instead, he gets a dirty trick.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: But first, one for you! Einon flings his shield at him. Bowen is knocked into the water. He deftly rolls and uses the shield to protect himself from the flailing hooves of Einon's horse as, laughing savagely, Einon charges over him and grabs Kara the hair, jerking her head back.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: Don't go anywhere, sweet. This won't take long. He bends over and ruthlessly kisses the squirming girl. A he does, Bowen springs up and slams the shield against Einon's back, unseating him from his horse.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Only expose your back to a corpse. That's one lesson you never learned. Einon's men start to rush in, but Einon comes up shaking water, eyes flashing.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: Stand back! (to Bowen) You are a corpse! The two engage. Trading fast and furious blows. As they fight, a shadow watches from behind the waterfall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two combatants are watched through the cascading wate The clank of steel is heard above the rushing water. And laboured breathing of Draco.  67

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The swordplay is dazzling and Bowen's holding his own. Bu Einon's younger. And faster.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: Lie down, Knight. Life has passed you by. You'tre the sorry scrap of dead world and dead beliefs! The taunts renew Bowen's fury.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: They were your beliefs!

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: Never! Never mine!

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: They were! The old code...

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: I spit on your code! I spit on it then. And I spit on it now!

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: No! You knew the words! You spoke them!

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: I vomitted them up because I couldn't stomach them. Bowen doesn't want to hear it. His sad fantasy that the Dragon tainted Einon is unravelling. Tears well in his ey He tries to shout down the truth.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Lies! I taught you...

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: ...-to fight! That's all! I took what I needed from you, knight. You taught me to fight! And well! It's the coup de grace. Bowen, dazed by his broken dream, attacks sloppily. Einon's blade rips across his shoulder sends the shattered knight spinning back onto his knees i the water. Einon charges in, blade upraised. But before he can deliv the deathblow, he's blinded by a SWOOSHING SPRAY OF WATER Growling, he shakes it from his eyes to discover... DRACO...between Einon and Bowen. Roaring fiercely. His wings swing up and the scales on his chest fall back, exposing...THE RED SCAR on his chest. Einon, quaking in fear, recognizes the Dragon...and his death and SCREAMS.  68 Dashing for his horse, the terrified king mounts and gall away. The rest of his minions follow him. Bowen staggers out of the water and sloshes over to Draco. He is still shaken and angry from his encounter with Einon.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Who asked you to butt in? I had everything under control! Draco doesn't answer. He watches Einon ride off, disturbe and concerned. Someone else is disturbed by something. Bowen feels a tug at his sleeve. It's Kara.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Just how is it you two know each other? -Bowen and Draco trade a sheepish glance. EXT. SWAMP VILLAGE - BRIDGE — DAY Bowen leads his horse across a rickety bridge over a swam river. Kara walks along side him. Bowen winces and rubs h wounded shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Here. Let me see. She opens his jerkin and tenderly removes the ragged band Bowen. watches her. Her head close to his. She looks up a catches him staring at her. He quickly shifts his gaze.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: It's all healed, Bowen. Just a little stiff. Bowen limbers up his arm. His eyes rove downriver where a cluster of MUD HUTS sit on an island in the middle of a DREARY, MIST-ENSHROUDED MARSH.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: That village ought to give it a little exercise. He looks up as a SHADOW passes overhead.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: But no medicine for your other wound. Bowen rubs his shoulder and glares at her. She appraises with hurt, disappointed, pleading eyes.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: I have no other wound.  69

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: You won't soothe your sick heart, Bowen, by wasting your courage and skill on worthless acts.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: What wound festers in you, girl?

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: A deep one. It hurts to know my heroes are nothing more than charlatans looking out only for themselves. A SHADOW intermittently passes over the pair.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Well, that's the way the wretched world turns, girl.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: And those who cannot look out for themselves?...You could lead them, Bowen. Give them hope.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: False hope! Even if you could raise a ragtag army, what chance do they have against seasoned troops? The last time they tried it ended up a massacre. I remember! I was there!

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: So was I. And I remember more. One lone knight who dare to stand against the king and saved a rebel from a blinding. (Bowen turns sharply) ---for a little while anyway..-.You, Bowen. The rebel was my father. She sadly fingers Red-beard's headband about her throat. Bowen looks at her, the memory slowly crystallizing.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Let others stand with you and this time the end will be different. Bowen takes her gently by the shoulders, gazing sadly in flaring eyes, drinking in her angry beauty with melanchol yearning. Unable to stand his probing gaze, Kara breaks away.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: What are you looking at?

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Myself once upon a time...  70 Bowen mounts his horse. As the Shadow passes overhead aga he calls up to it.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: I'll see you in the village, Draco. As he mounts up, Draco floats down beside Kara, appraisin her with sad, disturbed eyes.

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: What will you do, Kara?

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Try to turn the wretched world the other way. ‘Bowen turns back and looks at them for a moment and then spurs his horse over the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: Einon will not fall in my lifetime. Unable to look at her any longer, Draco zooms off downriv Kara watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bowen swats at BUZZING MOSQUITOS as he rides through a marshland river toward... A VILLAGE...situated on an island in the middle of a DREA MIST-ENSHROUDED MARSH. From the looks of it, the village fairly dreary too. From the mud and straw huts emerge SEVERAL TALL BRUTISH WARRIORS who come forth to meet Bowe They hesitate as the RUSTLE OF WINGS and WIND kicks past them, looking skyward. So does Bowen. Then he looks dubiously at the village. With a weary shake of his head, swats another mosquito and leads his horse through the shallow marsh. EXT. SWAMP VILLAGE - MONEY SACK —- DAY A MONEY SACK is passed from hand-to-hand...each dropping something of value in it. A coin or two...a tarnished gob +..a ring. CAMERA BACK as the sack is given to the VILLAG CHIEF -- a gaunt giant who holds the sack out to: BOWEN...miserable. The village is miserable. The villager are miserable. Towering, ragged giants, hollow cheeks and haunted eyes. No minion of Einon's here to gouge. Nor to act as a salve to his guilty conscience. Mortified, Bowen swats at the mosquitos that seem to abound. Even the clim and the livestock are miserable. He stares up at... DRACO...who menacingly flies over the swamp.  71

dialogues.speaker: KARA, (OS)
dialogues.text: Wait! KARA...pushes through the press of villagers.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: This man is a fraud! The Chief jerks the money back. Kara smiles in gloating triumph. Bowen thrusts out his dragonhorn shield.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Is this a fraud? That girl's a wandering idiot, babbling nonsense!

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: That's a lie! This Knight is no Dragonslayer.

dialogues.speaker: GILBERT, (OS)
dialogues.text: You're mistaken, my child. FRIAR GILBERT...emerges from the crowd, his parchment sac slung on his back, swatting at the mosquitos with a scrol A welcome sight for Bowen.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Gilbert!

dialogues.speaker: GILBERT
dialogues.text: (embraces him) Bowen, my lad! Praise the Saints, you're alive! And whole! (feels Bowen's arm to make sure; to Chief) You couldn't put your trust in a better man. I have personally seen him slay almost two dragons.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Almost?

dialogues.speaker: GILBERT
dialogues.text: Well, I didn't actually witness the deathblow to the second, but since Sir Bowen's here, he must have won!

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: (smugly) I never lose. Chief thrusts the money at Bowen again, but Kara stops hi

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: No! He's in league with the dragon!  72 Everyone stares at her. Bowen. Gilbert. The Villlagers. Their Chief...who slowly starts to chuckle, then laugh. H hands the money to Bowen who also laughs and makes a craz sign in reference to Kara.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Told you. An addle-pated ninny! Everyone is laughing now, except a fuming Kara!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bowen has once again devised "A WHACKER". Gilbert gleeful helps out, driving the ballast-cart ox into position unti Bowen signals him to stop.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Whoa, Gilbert. Hold it steady there! As Bowen loads and sights "The Whacker", Kara, like one o the constantly buzzing mosquitos, hovers beside Bowen, speaking so Gilbert cannot overhear.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: I thought you had sunk low, Bowen. But not this low.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Wait till you see how low Draco sinks. Twang! Bowen slices the rope-trigger and the HARPOON flie off toward... DRACO...who expertly snares the lance under his wing and, before, goes into his death-throes and swoons down into t marsh. But not under! He lands with a huge muddy splat th sprays both Kara and Bowen. Bowen wipes off muck, finding Draco at the edge of the sw belly up, eyes closed, frozen in an awkward death pose.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Well, sink! sink!

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: (not breaking his pose) How? It doesn't get any deeper. Kara laughs at their predicament. Bowen wheels and glares her, just as Gilbert coming joyously running up.

dialogues.speaker: GILBERT
dialogues.text: You've done it again, Sir Knight! Oooh, look at the brute. Bigger than the last one you tangled with.  73

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Actually, he's about the same size. Bowen steers Gilbert away. But he can't steer away... THE SWAMP PEOPLE...charging up. Armed to the teeth with axes. Mouths watering. Chanting rapturously.

dialogues.speaker: SWAMP PEOPLE
dialogues.text: Meat! Meat!

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Uh-oh... Shocked, Draco breaks his death tableau, jerking his head

dialogues.speaker: GILBERT
dialogues.text: Good Lord, It's alive! The swamp people halt when they see the dragon's not dead yet! But their Chief urges them on.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Quickly! Kill it while it's down. Bowen, having mounted, rides out to stop them.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: No! Stay back! They don't...rushing by him, chanting "Meat!", toward... DRACO...flopping up an@ fluttering about like a duck stuc the mud. He finally gets unstuck and, just as the swamp dwellers descend on him, whooshes out of the mud and out reach. The swamp people turn back, glaring with suspicious hunge at... BOWEN & KARA...who watch them start to close in.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: (to Kara) Happy now? They're on to us.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Us?

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Come on. We don't want to stay for dinner. He scoops Kara over the back of the saddle like a sack of wheat and spurs his horse through the pack of angry swamp More swampers rush...  74 GILBERT...utterly baffled by all this. He hollers a start screech and sloshes through the marsh, joining the panick parade of swampers, Bowen, Kara, and the horse. He runs smack dab into the chief, who raises his huge cleaver. Before it can come down, the money sack smacks h in the chops...flung by Bowen, riding up.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: No dragon, no charge! Bowen gives the priest a hand onto the rump of the overbu steed. Gilbert clutches slumped-over Kara's rump.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: GILBERT
dialogues.text: Forgive me! Kara squirms right side up, only backwards on the horse, facing Gilbert who reaches again for support, nearly grab Kara's breasts. Her scandalized look dissaudes him and he clutches Bowen's sides which causes his bald pate to nest in Kara's cleavage as the two are bobbled by the swerving horse. But no matter which way they turn, swampers are closing in. But there's one way left to turn. Up. And Draco provides it. Swampers go squealing, as Draco's wings FILL THE SCRE When he swoops OUT OF FRAME, all that's left in the swamp the swampers. The horse and its riders are gone. The swamp folk watch the low-flying Dragon and his cargo disappear into the DENSE FOG enshrouding the heart of the swamp. The Chief's sharp eyes stare up into the mist...to the craggy TOR jutting up out of the haze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SCREEN IS FILLED WITH THICK FOG, we hear FLAPPING WIN A FRIGHTENED NEIGH. THEN GILBERT'S QUAVERING VOICE.

dialogues.speaker: GILBERT, (0S)
dialogues.text: Saints perserve us! I nearly have my bald pate trimmed at my neck. I find you in league with a pair of rogues...one, a Dragon who kidnaps me...! Only to get us lost in this dreadful fog!

dialogues.speaker: DRACO, (0S)
dialogues.text: Not lost. Never lost. Draco's firm voice shushes the whining. As does the SIGHT looming out of the thinning fog....  75 THE RUINS OF AN ANCIENT CASTLE...seen from above. At its center is a RING OF EERIE STONE COLUMNS.

dialogues.speaker: GILBERT, (OS)
dialogues.text: What deadly, unholy place is this?

dialogues.speaker: DRACO, (OS)
dialogues.text: Most holy, priest. More than death dwells here, Brother Gilbert.

dialogues.speaker: GILBERT, (0S)
dialogues.text: W- What more?

dialogues.speaker: DRACO, (OS)
dialogues.text: A spirit. Beyond death. Alive and eternal. That remembers the Once-ways and the glory of one who shared our name.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN, (0S)
dialogues.text: What one?

dialogues.speaker: DRACO, (0S)
dialogues.text: The Pendragon!

dialogues.speaker: GILBERT
dialogues.text: Pend --! Arthur Pendragon!... King Arthur! A land of mist...Avalon! Avalon! Coming closer and closer into view!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gilbert prays before the tallest column in the circle of stone.

dialogues.speaker: GILBERT
dialogues.text: So it was foretold. And so I have found you, Brave Arthur. Among your brother knights in a grove upon a tor. Nota grove. But the Round Table of Camelot... This mention of the Round Table has it's affect on... BOWEN...moving solemnly among the stone columns, talking himself, touching the stones.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: The Round Table..Here was Sir Gawain's place...Here Galahad...

dialogues.speaker: GILBERT
dialogues.text: Let us who remember the glories of your golden kingdom feel your noble spirit, 0 King. Bowen weaves through the columns, stopping at the one jus the right of Arthur's.  76

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: »»-Lancelot...the right hand of Arthur.

dialogues.speaker: GILBERT
dialogues.text: -.and let the Song of Excalibur echo in our enemy's ear. Amen...I'm ready, my child. He rises and joins Kara. Both turn to Bowen, moving slowl to Arthur's stone.

dialogues.speaker: GILBERT
dialogues.text: And you, Bowen? Bowen is obviously moved by this experience, but not move enough to give Gilbert the answer he hopes for.

dialogues.speaker: GILBERT
dialogues.text: My son...This is Avalon. The shadow realm of the Round Table. It is a divine omen!

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Omens and shadows won't win battles. Nor will you. You'll find out soon enough when you try to raise your army. (to Kara) You already know the courage of your village. They're very brave at pelting girls with vegetables.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: It must start somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Will you wish us luck, Draco? She turns to... DRACO...perched on a crumbling castle turret framed betwe two of the stone columns, gazing up at the sky...at the D CONSTELLATION.

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: Long ago, when man was young and the dragon already old, the wisest of our race took pity on man and shared with him our secrets. And when this Wise One was dying, he gathered together all the dragons, making them vow to watch over man always. And at the moment of his death, the night became alive with those stars.  77

dialogues.speaker: "THE DRACO CONSTELLATION
dialogues.text: It glitters brightly in the black sky.

dialogues.speaker: DRACO, (0S)
dialogues.text: Through the years, his shimmering soul was joined by others, as the dragons kept their pledge to serve man...until the heavens were aglow with stars.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Draco looks back down on the trio below.

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: But then man grew arrogant with the gift of our power and shunned our guidance. And fewer stars ascended the sky to hold back black night. Draco gazes forlornly at the sky.

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: All my life I've longed to perform one deed worthy of those shining above. Finally my chance came. A great sacrifice that would reunite man and dragon and ensure my place among my ancient brothers of the sky... But my sacrifice became my sin.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: It was you. Your half-heart beats in Einon's breast. Draco descends into the circle of stone, baring the scale his breast, revealing a jagged crimson scar.

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: Yes. My half~heart that cost all my soul. Even then I knew his bloodthirsty nature, but I thought the heart could change him. My God, I was naive. Bowen barks a short savage laugh, then the bitterness in eyes is overwhelmed by tortured melancholy.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: (quiet hollowness) No more than I...Always I dreamed of serving noble kings and nobler ideals. But dreams die hard. And you hold them in your hands long after they've crumbled to dust. And in your heart long after they've soured to bitter poison... I will not be that naive again.  78

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: Kara, I will go with you. Bowen wheels to Draco, stunned by the declaration...And t sudden realization that now he is alone. But it does not change his conviction. He turns from the others and walks out of the circle of stone. Draco sadly watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: So be it. Farewell, Bowen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAIN comes down in torrents. CAMERA PANS TO... -BOWEN...who seeks shelter in the hollow of crumbling tur The wind howls. The rain lances through the ever-present mist. Bowen pulls up his cloak. Then he hears...A HOARSE WHISPER.

dialogues.speaker: WHISPER
dialogues.text: Valour...Valour... Bowen springs up, peering into rainy, windswept mist.

dialogues.speaker: WHISPER
dialogues.text: Valour... Bowen. whirls to the sound...It comes the stone columns.

dialogues.speaker: GHOST VOICE
dialogues.text: A knight is sworn to valour...

dialogues.speaker: GHOST VOICE
dialogues.text: His heart knows only virtue... Rising up, Bowen walks from his shelter, listening to the voices. Then a third VOICE joins the other GHOST VOICES...then a FOURTH...

dialogues.speaker: GHOST VOICE
dialogues.text: His blade defends the helpless...

dialogues.speaker: GHOST VOICE
dialogues.text: His might upholds the weak... Their hollow voices echo and overlap in the wind. A VOICE floats out of LANCELOT'S stone next to Bowen, who falls b

dialogues.speaker: LAUNCELOT'S VOICE
dialogues.text: His word speaks only truth. Then THE LAST VOICE...ARTHUR'S rises from his stone. Bowe collapses to his knees as more than Arthur's voice emerge from the stone...  79 ARTHUR'S GHOSTLY IMAGE...floats before the stunned knight Eerie and majestic. Pale and as wispy as the swirling mis Slashed by the rain. Wavering in the wind.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR'S VOICE
dialogues.text: His wrath undoes the wicked! More GHOST VOICES OF THE ROUNDTABLE JOIN the echoing brotherhood, reciting the Old Code in a crescendoing cacophony accompanied by the roaring thunder and the driv rain, whirling about Bowen in the whipping wind. Drenched in rain and tears, Bowen covers his head from th forbidding image of Arthur, from the jumble of sound, reciting the code himself in a breathless, rushed litany, trying to shout down the mad singsong racket of the spiri -voices, trying to keep the sense of the words and their Meaning.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: A knight is sworn to valour. His heart knows only virtue. Blade defends the helpless. Upholds the weak. Speaks only truth...! He's stopped, realizing his is the only voice he hears. T others are silent. All but one...Arthur's image is fading back into the stone.

dialogues.speaker: GHOST OF ARTHUR
dialogues.text: (faintly) His wrath... He's gone. Head bowed, Bowen kneels before Arthur's rock, reaching out to touch it.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: (whispering) +--undoes the wicked. Thunder roars. Lightning flashes. In its jagged light, something new is revealed.. DRACO...Bowen stares up longingly at him and Draco, the r streaming down his face, into his kindly eyes, stretches his wing to shield the knight from the storm. There they stay, huddled in the shadow of the rocky symbo their once-lost dreams and their new-found hope...two los souls cleansed and purified in the heavenly rain and reun in a common vision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A QUARTER-STAVE smashes down on another. CAMERA BACK, as one-eyed Hewe drives Kara to the ground with the blow. OT VILLAGERS crowd around, laughing and mocking. Gilbert scrambles to Kara's side and helps her to her feet.  80

dialogues.speaker: HEWE
dialogues.text: And we're suppose to follow you and a Priest against Einon! To Hell, more likely! We've had enough of your moon-~ eyed mischief, girl! Begone! Hewe raises his staff to beat them off. But AN ARROW suddenly imbeds itself in the staff. All eyes turn to... A RIDER...who slings his bow and gallops into the village framed against the rising sun. His horse rears as the rid halts between Gilbert and Kara and Hewe. It is... BOWEN...scrubbed and shaved. Clothes and armour, though frayed and worn, are clean and mended as best can be. His eyes shine with a fierce fine visionary fire. He plucks h ‘arrow from the staff.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Save your strength for the fight against Einon.

dialogues.speaker: HEWE
dialogues.text: (contemptuously) There isn't any fight against Einon.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: I'm going to start one. Kara and Gilbert react to this good news.

dialogues.speaker: HEWE
dialogues.text: You and what army, knight?

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: He'll enlist! He jerks a thumb over his shoulder at... DRACO...as he rising up from behind the horizon of a ridg Majestic. Aglow. Like fire. Ablaze in the morning sun.

dialogues.speaker: PREPARATIONS FOR WAR
dialogues.text: A FORGE blows fiery hot, as HEWE and the other BLACKSMITH smelt plowshears back into molten metal. OTHER PEASANTS contribute metal farm implements to the piles rising high the war effort. MOLTEN METAL is poured into MOLDS for swords, and pike-tips and arrow points. RAW WEAPONS hiss they are dipped in cold water and dumped onto tables wher MEN hone and sharpen them.  81 PEASANTS are flocking to the cause. Men come with their o ¢rude weapons and bring their families with them. Bowen a Gilbert sort them out and direct them to functions and ca placements. WOMEN AND CHILDREN work an arrow-making assembly line, stripping the shafts with "strippers, affixing points wit sinew, gluing feathers on. Finished arrows are bundled an stacked. BOWEN watches in amusement as GILBERT gets an archery les from some of the villagers. He struggles to pull back the bowstring. When he lets go of it, the bow goes flying and he's still holding onto the arrow. HEWE watches men run through a series of exercises with a PIKE, tilting at wooden models. A COMMAND TENT is going up behind Bowen as he discusses strategy with Gilbert, Kara, Hewe, and the other chosen generals. Parchment maps are strewn over a rickety table Gilbert, with a quill, draws lines and swirls on them at Bowen's direction.

dialogues.speaker: GILBERT, (VO)
dialogues.text: The sky's untouched without the reach, The dream's no good without the dare, And one must fight for what one wants, Tis purpose God attends, not prayer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kara swings a heavy BATTLE-AXE through a series of exerci As she whirls it above her head, the momentum sends her staggering back against... BOWEN...who stops her fall..

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Easy...

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: (shyly) oh...Thank you... She doesn't move. Nor is he in any hurry to dislodge her. They're very close, staring stupidly at each other, befor Bowen awkwardly seques from romance to warfare. Not letti go of her, he nudges her legs apart with one of his own.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Here...widen your stance. He guides her arms up, holding the axe aloft.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Up...then down.  82 Their arms swing down together. Their bodies sway forward his pressed tightly against her from behind.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: That's it...One fluid stroke.. The downward arc of the axe almost throws Kara off-balanc But Bowen's enfolding arms steady her. Her hair brushes h face. Her lips almost touch his cheek as she turns to hin

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: That could cleave a man's skull.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Like a pudding. Neither moves from their awkward embrace. Her warm breath intoxicates him and he reels back from her spell, axe in hand. Then grinning with school-boy bravura, he flings th axe. It spirals through the air, striking a PUMPKIN and splitting it neatly in two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BOWSTRING is pulled tentatively back... GILBERT...is the archer, receiving patient instruction fr Bowen.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: That's it! Sight along the arrow. Now release! "THWACK!" THE ARROW buries itself right in the middle of STRAW MAN'S HEART. CAMERA PANS to Gilbert. He smiles proudly over at... THE DUMBFOUNDED PEASANTS...mouths agape...including Hewe.

dialogues.speaker: HEWE
dialogues.text: Beginner's luck! Try again! Gilbert eagerly notches another arrow, consummately performing Bowen's directions and lets fly. This time it hits the straw dummy right between the eyes. Bowen lets o a long, impressed whistle.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Brother Gilbert, you're a natural.

dialogues.speaker: GILBERT
dialogues.text: This is fun!

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Not for the fellow you're aiming at. Try again.  83 He points at the straw target again. Gilbert delightedly lets fly with another direct hit. Right in the dumny's crotch. Bowen grins and looks over at a disbelieving Hewe and shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: A natural.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bowen sleeps in his tent. Suddenly, A BELLOWING HONKING W pierces his slumber, He jerks awake, naked to the waist, eyes wide with a startled groggy glaze. He turns to see.. Kara...holding a war trumpet.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Battle horn! Good tone, don't you think? No, Bowen doesn't think. He just mumbles inarticulately. Kara throws his jerkin in his face.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Sun's up, Knight. So's the army. Why aren't you? Breakfast! She stuffs a hunk of bread into his mouth. Bowen heaves a muffled groan.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Too dry? She yanks the bread from his slack~jawed mouth. He puffs lips and sleepily tries to blow the sprinkled crumbs off them. Kara dips the bread in a goblet of wine and crams i back into his mouth. Both bread and wine dribble down his chin. He looks at Kara in sleepy irritation. She's just t perky.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Come on. Time's awasting. She hustles behind him, slapping a wet cloth on his back. yelps his first word of the morning.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Well, good morning to you too! Too cold? Bowen snatches the cloth from her and wipes the sleep fro his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Too fast! What's the hurry?  84

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: There's much to be done. Troops to train, strategy to plan, crises to be solved.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: (pulls on his jerkin) What crises? Kara grabs his jaw in her hand and, mushing up his cheeks jerks his face back and forth,

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: That beard, for one. It could use a trim. She holds up her axe. Bowen grabs her arm.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Don't worry, you taught me well.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: To cut throats, not to shave them!

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Well, if you don't want to look like a victorious general...

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: I'm not yet! Don't be overconfident.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: You're my confidence! I've never been more sure of anything in my life! Come! She takes his hand and yanks him toward the tent exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HQ TENT...waiting there is a delegation of chiefs and generals lead by Gilbert and Hewe. Many other warriors an villagers crowd about. Before the tent is a cross-pole covered by a heavy cloth.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Tomorrow we will look to you... glowing at our head like a shining beacon... She gestures to the draped poles. Hewe whip off the cloth...revealing A BEAUTIFUL SET OF GLISTENING ARMOR. Th emblem on the breastplate is Draco's golden profile. Gilb hands him the helmet. Bowen admires it in stunned awe.  85

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: They made it for you...All of them, out of old kettles and plows and horseshoes -..Gilbert designed it. Hewe hammered and polished it. And over your heart...Draco as the emblem of your courage. Bowen is touched. His fingers lightly caress the golden profile of Draco.

dialogues.speaker: GILBERT
dialogues.text: It was all Kara's idea.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: A knight's armour should be as bright as his honour. AN OLD WOMAN emerges from the crowd and, in silent revere touches Bowen's face. Others then reach out to touch him. Warrior, women, children. All press close to touch him or give a word of thanks. Speechless, overcome with emotion, Bowen bolts to his tent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside, they shout for him. Bowen stares at the helmet i his trembling hands.

dialogues.speaker: KARA, (0S)
dialogues.text: Shall I help you put it on? Bowen turns. Kara stands there with the rest of the armou

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Please... He attends to the arm guards while she fastens the leggin He feels her soft hands on his calves. So close. So beautiful. She helps him on with the breastplate.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: How fast your heart beats...

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: They expect much.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: They will give much.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: And if I don't lead them to victory?

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Then you'll have lead them farther than they ever dared go before... She steps back to inspect him.  86

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: There. All done.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Not quite. It is custom to bestow a favour on a knight.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: A favour?

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: A veil or a scarf that he wears into battle as a token from his lady.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Bo you have a lady?

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: I should be honoured to wear your favour.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: I...I have no such finery. I'm not a lady. I'm a peasant.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: You are the woman I love. Kara stiffens at this blunt confession. Thrilled by it, b frightened by it. He gently turns her to him.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: I can give no favour. I can give nothing. Lost honour can be recovered, not so lost youth. The one thing that was mine to give Einon stole forever.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: No...not your heart... Kara looks into his eyes, bright with love. She takes her father's HEADBAND from around her neck and ties it to his arm. He leans down and kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brok rides through a field, his Falcon perched on his arn TWO BEATERS marching before him flush A COVEY OF DOVES fr the undergrowth.

dialogues.speaker: BROK, (0S)
dialogues.text: Hungry, Pet...? He removes the hood from his Falcon's head.

dialogues.speaker: BROK
dialogues.text: Eat...  87 He watches the Falcon soar skyward with bloodthirsty amusement and, spurring his horse, he follows the flight birds over....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .-.the crest of the ridge. In the valley below, Brok sees THE REBEL CAMP...teeming with well-armed peasants as far the eye can see. A SUDDEN ROAR echoes out over the valley It is an ALARUM that alert the entire camp to readiness. suddenly sees... BOWEN...ride out on his charger. He turns back and signal to Gilbert, Hewe with a small body of armed men behind th He also signals to... DRACO...perched on the rocky cliff rising up out of the g behind the village, roaring out his alarum again. This is enough for... BROK...who gazes at the dragon with startled eyes, then a Bowen charging up toward him. Brok whips his horse around and takes off the way he came..

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Brok tears into the castle gates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GALLOPING WARRIORS ride into a castle courtyard, bustling with war preparations. Weapons are cached. Food and provisions are stored. Guards prowl the battlements.

dialogues.speaker: EINON, (OS)
dialogues.text: I'm served by fools and dolts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Einon is in council with his lords and generals.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: Peasants fleeing right under your noses. And taking my grain and livestock with them!

dialogues.speaker: FELTON
dialogues.text: But how could we know, Your Majesty? A few peasants here and there...

dialogues.speaker: BROK
dialogues.text: A few, fop? Hundreds! Armed and spoiling for a fight!  88

dialogues.speaker: FELTON
dialogues.text: Then let them have it! One of us is worth a hundred of them. Are you afraid, Sir Brok? With a snarl, Brok almost charges across the table at Fel but Einon slams him back and smiles calmly at Felton, pat his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: My brave Felton. A regiment unto himself. Einon slams Felton down on the table onto a clutter of ma

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: Idiot! I know this man who leads them. (shouts to all) And I will beat him! But I will not underestimate him! And do not forget the dragon.

dialogues.speaker: AISLINN, (0S)
dialogues.text: Fear not the dragon, my son. AISLINN...stands silhouetted in the doorway and crosses t him.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: I fear nothing. Nothing! Do you understand? He pulls her aside.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: It's just that...sometimes I sense him. Feel him. As though he were close. But be clear. I don't fear him!

dialogues.speaker: AISLINN
dialogues.text: No need to, my son... She motions him to follow her outside. Curious, he does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Einon follows his mother out. She gestures to the courtya below. FIVE BURLY TARTARS, all armed to the teeth, stand the courtyard below.

dialogues.speaker: AISLINN
dialogues.text: A mother's gift to her son...Uhlric, Volney, Jugurtha, and the brothers Odolf and Oram. The finest to be had. The Five all bow. Einon looks from the men to his mother.  89

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: Finest what...?

dialogues.speaker: AISLINN
dialogues.text: Dragonslayers. Struck by this uncharacteristic kindness, Einon's disbeli slowly shifts to sly amusement. Aislinn returns her son's smile. He impulsively grabs his mother's hand and kisses

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A guardpost BONFIRE burns brightly as Bowen approaches it carrying something in hand. It is his DRAGON-HORNED SHIEL He casts it into the flame. It burns furiously with an -almost SUPERNATURAL LIGHT...LIKE MAGNESIUM. Brilliant gl spark and flare off the burning horns.

dialogues.speaker: DRACO, (0S)
dialogues.text: Well done. Bowen turns to see Draco behind hin.

dialogues.speaker: . BOWEN
dialogues.text: A knight of the Old Code needs no such adornment.

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: (agrees) No...It burns brightly.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Like a promise of hope.

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: No, Bowen, your hope lies down there. Draco nods to... THE VALLEY..-below. It is alive with the cookfires gleami in the twilight. We hear singing, children crying, laught All the sounds of life going on.

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: The one I've waited for. Man must now make of the world what he can...The day of dragons is done.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Not done for you. If we are victorious tomorrow, we'll have need of you.  90

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: You'll have victory, but no need of me. Listen to them, Knight of the Old Code, The Once-ways are in their songs and their laughter and the cries of their children. Listen and look. Draco's voice is strangely cryptic and wistful. Bowen loo at him in suspicious concern.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: What do you see?

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: Everything. It yours now. His sad eyes turn once more to the bonfire and the bright burning dragon shield. Its glow becomes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +.-The DRACO EMBLEM on Bowen's armour glinting gold in th sunlight. Tied to his arm is Kara's favour. He is at the head of his ARMY. Draco's image is also on the banners flapping gloriously in the morning breeze. IN SEVERAL SHOTS AND ANGLES, THE CAMERA CATCHES the motle but proudly determined army as it MARCHES out of camp. Ka and Gilbert ride by Bowen's side. Hewe, foot, marches at head of the troop with the other "GENERALS". Hewe glances up. Others follow his gaze as... DRACO...swoops overhead. He dips a wing in salute. BOWEN...acknowledges Draco's salute with a raised sword a the dragon banks left in the direction of Einon castle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they, too, raise their weapons in salute to the dragon whose SHADOW ripples over then,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A VOLLEY OF FIRE ARROWS SHOOT through the sky, bouncing harmlessly off the castle wall and sputtering out. CAMERA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SMALL TROOP OF REBELS...shabby and pitiful, led by Bowe down in the field before the castle have fired the arrows

dialogues.speaker: EINON, (0S)
dialogues.text: (laughing) Seems you overestimated their numbers, Brok.

dialogues.speaker: EXT, EINON'S CASTLE
dialogues.text: Einon, Brok, Felton and others observe the puny rebel for as another PATHETIC VOLLEY OF FIRE ARROWS plunk against t parapet wall. ONE ARROW actually makes it over the wall. Einon calmly reaches out and catches it in mid-air in his gauntletted hand. He blasely inspects it.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: And twelve years hasn't improved their ain. Felton chuckles and smirks at Brok.

dialogues.speaker: FELTON
dialogues.text: They'll get bored and go home before dark.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: Why wait? We'll send you out to chase them off. After all, "One of us is worth a hundred of them." The numbers seem about right. Felton gulps uneasily as Einon wags the fire arrow in his face. But a worried Brok is unamused, ominously scanning sky.

dialogues.speaker: BROK
dialogues.text: There were more! And where's the...? Brok chokes on the question as the answer comes in view.. DRACO...suddenly flies out of the sunlight and, swooping down, sprays the battlements with fire, sending soldiers screaming and leaping to safety. As Einon and his general also dash for cover, they look up to see... DRACO...flying out of the smoke of the explosion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a field between the castle walls and the forest masses peasant army, BOWEN and HEWE at its head. The rebels chee as Draco rains more flame down on the denizens of the cas

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE DRAGONSLAYERS manuever a LARGE CATAPULT THAT SHOOTS HARPOONS into place, scanning the sky for...  92 DRACO...who suddenly swoops up from behind the castle wal surprising the Dragonslayers who abandon there catapult a Draco looses a firebomb at them. As the catapult swerves, Volney is knocked against the triggering mechanism, discharging the harpoon which goes flying and strikes... A STUNNED JUGURTHA...right through his chest, impaling hi the wall. His giant axe, still gripped in his hand, knock soldier off the battlements, sending him plummet ing to t ground at the feet of... EINON'S HORSE...the young king is mounted, at the head of armoured knights. The horse rears as Einon frowns at the soldier, then at the blazing catapult on the battlement.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: Oh, lovely... He draws his sword and shouts to his men.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: Well, do we stay in here like sitting ducks or crush those rebellious dogs? Brok leads a chorus of war-cries. And as the gates are opened, Einon and his mounted horse, followed by foot soldiers, pour out of the castle, watched by... AISLINN...from a tower window. Einon and his men rush the peasants who retreat for the forest. She glances up at... DRACO...hovering above, oblivious to the spears of the Dragonslayers, watching the peasants run...almost smiling

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The peasants retreat without a blow being struck. Einon, spies Bowen in the rout. He laughs deliriously.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: After them! Shear them like the sheep they are. And Einon and his riders give chase into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: BUT EINON HAS MADE A TACTICAL MISTAKE.
dialogues.text: As soon as all the king's riders are wheeling admidst the trees, Bowen wheels his horse on a rise.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Now!  93 Behind Einon's calvary, A REBEL swings by on a rope out o tree, a FLAMING FAGGOT IN HIS HANDS. He dips the torch in TRENCH filled with PITCH. The fire runs across the forest and up both sides creating a U-shaped barrier boxing in t knights. The horses panic as the walls of flame rise around them. Then they descend... HUNDREDS OF PEASANTS...Bowen motions them forward with hi sword and they charge en masse. Panicked knights try to j their horses through the flames as pikemen pick knights o horses and the swordmen and axe-wielders fall upon them. CAMERA CLOSES IN ON EINON as he realizes his mistake but ‘assumes comand.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: Scatter or die! Einon leaps his horse over the fire. Others follow his example as his force splits up in the forest and comes fa to-face with more rebel mischief. Barrages of arrows fly out of bushes and trees picking me off. More rebels lie in wait in the forest. The peasant assault is swift and surprising and deadly. A men are dvided and trapped, overwhelming numbers of rebel appear to finish them off in hand-to-hand combat. THE CAMERA PANS THROUGH THE MAYHEM... BROK...bashes through a phalanx of peasants with a mace a chain and encounters Hewe with his quarter staff. The two tangle it up. ELSEWHERE... GILBERT AND OTHER ARCHERS...perched in an archer blind wa THREE ARMED RIDERS charge a group of rebels. With lightni speed Gilbert notches an arrow and shoots. THE ARROW...strikes a TAUT ROPE tied off to a tree branch neatly slices it in two. The rope slides through the branches, releasing... A LOG...suspended overhead which comes crashing down in f of the three riders. Their horses rear up and the riders rock off their saddles. As they tumble to the ground, the rebels rush them. GILBERT...crosses himself.

dialogues.speaker: GILBERT
dialogues.text: Pride goeth before a fall, brother!  94 Meanwhile below... FELTON...sword in hand, helmetless, cowardly scurries fro tree to tree through the commotion, avoiding any fight he can. But as he creeps around the bole of a tree, a pitchf is thrust at his face. He jerks back and the tines of the fork embed in the tree trunk. Felton whirls face-to-face with... HIS MINX...she's gone over to the rebels! Felton's stunne rage gives him a sudden flash of courage.

dialogues.speaker: FELTON
dialogues.text: You traitorous witch! After all, I've spent on... (catches himself) «.-done for...you! She sneers and tries to yank her pitchfork from the tree. But before she can, Felton, brave against a helpless woma snaps the shaft in two with his sword blade. The minx staggers back with the broken end. Felton advanc on her, but... GILBERT...has spotted them and looses an arrow from his b It pierces... FELTON...in the rear. Dropping his sword, he yelps in pai GILBERT...also yelps for joy.

dialogues.speaker: GILBERT
dialogues.text: Turn the other cheek! However, it is... THE MINX...who turns Felton's other cheek, by whacking hi the jaw with her broken shaft. The lamps go out in his ey and he crumples to the ground. Elsewhere... KARA...fights among a group of peasants and soldiers. Whirling her axe with expert skill she holds her ATTACKER also wielding an axe, at bay. But she is so busily engage she does not see the other two ENEMIES rushing up to help their companion. But.. BOWEN...riding across the field does. He gallops his hors between the two swordsmen and extending his legs, kicks b of them into the dirt as he rides by. He then leaps from his charging horse and rushes to Kara' side just as she neatly dispatches her adversary and grab his axe as he falls. Whirling both axes, she smiles over Bowen.  95

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Like a pudding!

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: More pudding's coming. Kara's being rushed by two men. Bowen by three. One he quickly dispatches and takes his sword. He grips his two blades, Kara her two axes. Grinning grimly, shoulder-to- shoulder, they take on all-comers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Volney the Tartar supervises the loading of hideous barbe GRAPPLING HOOKS into the bowls of THREE CATAPULTS, cranke ‘and ready. Draco streaks right to left directly overhead. Commanding the king's soldiers, Volney cranks the first lever.

dialogues.speaker: VOLNEY
dialogues.text: Now! The catapults wang off in order, hurling their nasty load the dragon. But Draco is a skilled warrior. He sees the missiles comi and dodges them all. With his right hand, he catches the last hook and, yanking viciously, he does a barrel roll o of frame. Back on the platform, the BOLTS fastened to the catapult way like driven into balsa. The catapult skews sideways a wedges under two others. The force of Draco's pull rips u the whole mess SMASHING into Volney and the soldiers agai the stone walls, crushing them to death and taking out a piece of new masonry. Through a window arch below, Volney hangs upside down, his eyes sightless in death...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the smoke and confusion rides... EINON...slicing through a band of rebels. The battle goes badly for him. He shouts above the fray.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: Retreat! His men readily obey and scatter through the woods. He sp his horse and joins their flight.  96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bowen and Kara are pressed back-to-back as Einon suddenly rides by. Both recognize him.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: _Gilbert, stop him! Gilbert also recognizes Einon and notches a METAL-PIERCIN ARROW. As he tautly, tensely pulls back the bow, he is grimly aware for the first time of the full power of his remarkable talent. But though his conscience wavers, his bow-arm does not.
