dialogues.speaker: GILBERT
dialogues.text: Thou...shalt...not...kill... He lets fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The arrow strikes true. Einon jerks in his saddle as the arrow pierces his mail a imbeds deep in his heart! Staggered by the impact, he suc in his breath. But he does not fall. He doesn't even feel the pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EINON'S CASTLE...where Draco suddenly recoils in mid-air grasping his chest, howls in real pain, no scam this time

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With devastating skill, both Kara and Bowen dispatch thei enemies. For both have witnessed all... Einon taking the arrow, Draco's screech of pain and fall.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Draco!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EINON...still alive, also watching the Dragon spiral and flutter down. He looks at the arrow in his breast and, hi eyes glinting with understanding, calmly pulls it from hi chest and smiles at its bloody tip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the pain-wracked Draco flutters into range, Uhlric springs the catapult. NETS OF IRON MESH shoot out.  97

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Einon sees the Iron Nets enfold the dragon as he topples behind the castle walls with a groan. Realizing, what thi means, Einon spurs his horse toward the castle gates.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: The Dragonslayers! Noooo! He rides hell-bent for leather as...

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN, (OS)
dialogues.text: Nooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With an anguished shout, Bowen tears down the hill for Ei Kara watches his furious, futile chase and exchanges a worried glance with Gilbert, who rushes up to her. They b look to Bowen who has given up his chase. He turns to the his face a mask of anguished determination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The remaining dragonslayers...Uhlric, Odolf, and Oram... netted the limp form of Draco. He lies still and quiet, several of his horns are broken off. The Dragonslayers mo in cautiously, when Draco suddenly shifts on his side, moaning, clutching his chest. Ulhric and the brothers swarm in on the beast. But sudden a wild Einon is upon them, beating them back with his swo

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: No! I want it alive! Einon grimly leers at the pain-wracked, semi-conscious Dr

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: Chain it! Bind its wounds! I want it alive...And safe!

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: (whispered groan) No...

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: Yes...Safe for all eternity. Fear not, dragon, Bowen will come. A knight of the Old Code does not abandon a comrade-in- arms. He laughs and departs. Draco struggles weakly under the nets. BUT THE CAMERA PANS UP TO...  98 AISLINN...on the battlements...gazing on Draco in solemn concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hewe and the rebels survey the carnage they have wrought. Savouring the taste of victory. Tall and proud. Men once more. As Bowen, Kara, and Gilbert emerge into the forest, Hewe salutes them with an upraised sword and a smile. But his smile vanishes when he sees their long faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Einon stands on the battlements, gazing out at the forest -below. It is dotted with THE GLOW OF THE REBEL CAMPFIRES Then reverberating from the castle walls comes A MOURNFUL TRILL. Einon looks down into the courtyard below where Dr is chained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Draco's MELANCHOLY TRILL echoes from the castle walls out across the night to the forest's edge where camp a dispir group of rebels. CAMERA PANS TO: BOWEN...listening to Draco's sad song in anguish as Gilbe dresses a wound on Kara's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Why does he keep him alive! He must be torturing him.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: No, Einon will not torture him. He will not harm him in any way. Bowen turns to her, not understanding.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: (remembering) "Einon will not fall in my lifetime" ...-Draco's words to me once. I saw him go down. No one touched him. It was when Gilbert shot Einon.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: What are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: GILBERT
dialogues.text: When my arrow pierced Einon's heart that was when Draco screamed and fell. Bowen stares at them in dumbfounded disbelief, refusing t contemplate what is being suggested.  99

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Don't you see? It's the heart. The Dragon's heart. For Einon to die, Draco must die! :

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: No! No...Gilbert must have missed. (fiercely) It doesn't matter. Nothing matters except that Draco is still alive. Bowen hops up on a stump and shouts to his men.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: I go to save the Dragon. Who goes with me? No rush to volunteer. Just muttered oaths and sullen face Bowen turns in disgust to find Kara holding out his sword

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: You do not go alone.

dialogues.speaker: GILBERT
dialogues.text: No...not alone... GILBERT...who plops his helmet on his head. Bowen slides the sword into his scabbard. Hewe and the ot watch in silent shame, as the three march off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Draco lies heavily chained in a dark courtyard. His back feet and front paws are shackled tightly to the ground, a his tail, allowing almost no movement. His neck and head also chained down to keep him from breathing fire on his restraints. His chin upon the cold stone, he can only loo at the wall straight ahead of him...or out of the corner his eye, where he sees... UHLRIC...on guard, appraising Draco, spitting with distas Then he hears...A FOOTSTEP. Challenging with his spear, Uhlric recognizes a DIM FIGURE in the shadow.

dialogues.speaker: UHLRIC
dialogues.text: Oh...Come for a peek at the royal pet? Suddenly, Uhlric's eyes widen in surprise. A KNIFE flashe out of the dark in the shadow's hand.

dialogues.speaker: ON DRACO
dialogues.text: He hears a STRANGLED GASP. Uhlric WEAVES INTO VIEW, grasp his throat. He collapses to the ground. His spear rolls from his lifeless fingers almost to Draco's snout.  100 Out of the corner of his eye, Draco sees the Shadow.

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: Come from the shadows, Aislinn. Stand where I can see you. Aislinn comes forth. Sheathing her bloodstained dagger. Gazing down on the man she killed. Then at Draco.

dialogues.speaker: AISLINN
dialogues.text: You know why I've come?

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: AISLINN
dialogues.text: A sorry end...

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: The only end. In giving my heart, I have taken on every pain and poison stirring in his black breast. Even the pain of his death must be mine. Too long I've waited...

dialogues.speaker: AISLINN
dialogues.text: (sits by him) No one would blame you...Death without immortality.

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: That was not the only reason...To rid the world of Einon, would not rid it of evil. I had to wait. Wait for a time when mankind would not repeat my sin and let tyranny thrive. When there would be those who remembered the Once-ways. Remembered that even in the darkness there is still light and those who watch over them...I cannot see. Are the stars shining tonight?

dialogues.speaker: AISLINN
dialogues.text: (weeping) Brightly, my lord, brightly.

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: Then there is light enough. My soul need not flicker above.

dialogues.speaker: AISLINN
dialogues.text: It is my sin, Dragon Lord, for a mother's misguided heart, you gambled eternity and lost...Forgive me. Aislinn rises. Picks up Uhlric's spear. It is heavy, but she manages. But suddenly A HAND tears the spear from Aislinn's grasp. Einon's hand!  101

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: I know why you brought me the dragon- slayers, Mother. You wanted them to kill him. You wanted me dead.

dialogues.speaker: AISLINN
dialogues.text: I wanted to correct a mistake made years ago when I saved a creature not worth saving.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: How unmotherly of you. His voice is like ice, but Aislinn does not flinch. DRACO...eyes filled with terror, watches...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO SHADOWS on the wall, one raising a SHADOW SPEAR to st the other.

dialogues.speaker: DRACO, (0S)
dialogues.text: No-o-o-o!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kara leads Gilbert and Bowen to the hole in the wall's ro foundation. As they are about to enter, Draco's wailing lament echoes from inside. The three exchange a worried glance and dart into the passage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kara leads Bowen and Gilbert into the cistern from the passageway. Bowen charges for the courtyard door.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Not that way. Too dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: HEWE, (OS)
dialogues.text: Then that's our way. Bowen and the others wheel around to see... HEWE...and a SMALL BAND OF MEN enter the secret passage.

dialogues.speaker: HEWE
dialogues.text: We've got to open the gates for rest of us waiting outside. Touched by this loyalty, Bowen warmly claps Hewe on shoul

dialogues.speaker: HEWE
dialogues.text: Go save your dragon.  102 He opens the door that leads to the castle grounds and, taking a cautionary peek, motions his men out. Kara point to the other stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: This leads to the castle. We can see the whole courtyard from there. Bowen starts up, but Kara holds him back. Their eyes meet Both know this may be the last quiet moment they share. S tightens her "favour" on his arm.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: You carry my favour. Carry this too... She leans up and kisses him. Bowen enfolds her in his arm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The secret passage opens. Bowen, Kara, and Gilbert creep in...only to find Einon comfortably sprawled on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: What a pleasant surprise. I expected you, Knight. But my bride-to-be, as well? And with a priest to wed us.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: To bury you, Einon. Blade out, Bowen charges, stabbing only the bedclothes, a Einon whirls off the bed, arrogantly grinning.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: Well, to bury one of us! His blade meets Bowen's in mid-air. And the two engage in fast and furious swordplay. The clanging blades attract T GUARDS outside the chamber. Gilbert and Kara intercept th charge as Bowen and Einon duel near the fireplace. Einon good. Very good. Bowen has taught him well. He ducks a slash of Einon's blade and executes an athletic drop-kick against the king that sends him careening down the stairw of the secret passageway. Bowen leaps down after him. Kara, dispatching her guard, begins to follow Bowen and Einon. But Gilbert, the sword not being his weapon, is ha pressed and she goes to his aid instead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Einon rumbles down the stone steps and slumps lifelessly there. Bowen rushes dwn on the limp form... ---and nearly gets decapitated, as Einon's eyes flick ope and he lunges.  103 Angered, Bowen attacks with a wild sally. Einon, confiden in his invincibility, cooly deflects the blade and forces Bowen back into the cistern.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: Practice what you preach, mentor. Purpose, not passion, remember? The jibe only intensifies Bowen's reckless assault.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: Nerve cold blue... Taunting, Einon nimbly ducks a vicious swipe, executes a swift thrust that scores a vicious slash across Bowen's c

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: «.+.Blade blood red. Bowen ducks a vicious thrust and nearly loses his balance the edge of the cistern pool. As he teeters there, Einon takes a savage swipe, but this time it is Bowen who flips away...over the water on the other side of the cistern. E Einon's impressed. He barks a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: Still have a few lessons to teach me, mentor?

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Just one more.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: What, pray, is that?

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: The last one your father learned. The wound has renwed Bowen's cool vigor. He is calm and h as he drives Einon up into a dark cistern tunnel. All tha can be seen in the blackness are the blue sparks of the clanging blades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cringing FELTON flattensd against a staircase wall. Rap steps descend and Kara appears, gripping her axe, trying decide which way to go. Felton, realizing his enemy is only a woman, sweeps out o the shadows like a spider, his sword at her throat as he leers triumphantly over her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: FELTON
dialogues.text: This will put me in good with his majesty.  104

dialogues.speaker: HEWE, (0S)
dialogues.text: I doubt it. A quarterstave crashes down on his head. The lamps go out his eyes and, as his blade slides harmlessly away from Ka he crumples slack-jawed to the ground. Kara wheels to fin Hewe standing over the collapsed Felton.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: I'm in your debt.

dialogues.speaker: HEWE
dialogues.text: I'm in yours. Your father would be proud. They continue on their seperate ways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Einon drives Bowen up a castle stairwell. The knight is hard-pressed, but holding his own.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: We know each other's every move. But I'm younger and faster.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: I'll slow you so you won't get any older. The duellists fight their way up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kara, axe in hand, whirls onto a battlement through the wreckage of the dragonslayers' catapults. She turns to ge her bearings straight and sees A HUGE SHADOW looming on t wall behind her, hoisting a HUGE SHADOW SWORD.. Kara wheels around to confront Brok, but her axe is no ma for Brok's heavy descending sword. The impact tears the weapon from her hand and sends her careening into the dea dragonslayer, Jugurtha, still impaled on the wall. She snatches THE GIANT AXE still cluthced in his dead han and jerks the heavy shaft with two hands to fend off Brok blade, But the sword slices right through the shaft. The weight the axe jerks Kara to safety. The blade whizzes by her. Brok wheels, Kara swings the butt of the broken axe-pole against Brok's shield, It cracks him under the jaw and throws him off-guard. She twirls the axe, blade up, and thrusts it up between Brok's legs. He crumbles to the ground, devastated.  105

dialogues.speaker: BROK
dialogues.text: A girl?...a girl? Kara jerks the axe from the corpse.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Like a pudding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hewe and his marauders descend upon the guards, slaying t and opening the gate...only to find AN OUTER GATE beyond. Also guarded. Before Hewe's men can cut them down, one SENTRY blows ALARUM on a Ram's horn.

dialogues.speaker: EXT, CASTLE TOWER
dialogues.text: Bowen and Einon ascend the tower steps, blades flashing furiously. They've heard the alarum. Bowen grins.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: My rebels are storming your castle.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: Pity you won't live to see them fail. Einon's blade nearly slices off an ear. Angered, Bowen manuevers Einon around and proceeds to back him up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hewe and his band are beset by Einon's SOLDIERS as they struggle with the gate. But suddenly, several GUARDS pitc forward,slain by a rapid volley of arrows fired by... GILBERT...Hewe smiles and salutes him with a wave. Then t gates open and, with wild war shouts, the REBELS pour in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Odolf, in the courtyard, looks to Oram on the parapet. Bo grip their spears in edgy tenseness, reacting to the soun of battle, the fight up the tower, and Draco's writhing agony. His arm GLOWS A THROBBING RED where Bowen cut Eino

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bowen and Einon burst through the door into a half-crumbl TOWER-ROOM. It is roofless, most of it's walls destroyed, open to the elements. Its vantage point gives us a spectacular view of the whole castle and the country beyo And Draco chained in the courtyard below.  106 They duel over and around building materials and scaffold locked in fierce combat. Sparks fly from their clanging blades. Bowen presses Einon hard.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: (cold hate) Once you held this sword in a sacred oath, which you broke. Now embrace it again. Bowen swipes a wicked thrust that Einon barely sidesteps. Bowen blade cracks against a piece of masonry. Einon whir in with no mercy. Bowen tosses his broken hilt at Einon a dives into a clutter of scaffolding. Einon chops and hack at it sending splintered chips flying as he tries to fini Bowen off. He laughs in malicious glee, eyes glinting lik “madman.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: Fool! You lost before you began. I am immortal! Bowen leaps up, twirling onto a crossbeam, out and over Einon, who spins to cut him down before he lands.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Bowen! Kara has appeared on the roof and throws her axe to Bowen still in mid-air. Catching it, he lands and catches Einon blade on it. Einon is jarred back and Bowen sends the axe flying. It shrieks through the air, just missing Einon's head and burying itself in the heavy wooden shutter of a window in a partially rebuilt wall. still off-balance, Ei strikes. Bowen leaps the thrust and jumps onto the low si to yank his axe free. It won't budge. Einon snarls a laugh and lunges. Bowen pushes off from th sill and, clinging to the axe-handle, rides the shutter a swings out. Einon cannot stop his momentum and he spills of the window into space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Einon's body tumbles from the window, crashes through scaffolding, sending building materials as well as himsel careening down on top of and into the cistern in a cacoph of clatter, clutter, and dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Einon along with wreckage, plunges beneath the surface the water.  107

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kara dashes to the window, as Bowen clings to his axe-han on the swinging shutter. Both look down.

dialogues.speaker: CISTERN
dialogues.text: Einon has disappeared into the watery depths beneath the wreckage of scaffolding and cistern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bowen looks over at Kara.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: So much for his immortality. But echoing below comes Draco's AGONIZED GROAN! Bowen cal to the dragon, whose pain-wracked body GLOWS RED TORMENT.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: Draco! Just then...the axe gives in the shutter! Then unwedges itself and Bowen falls out into space.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Bowen! But he doesn't go far. He has grabbed hold of a PULLEY-LI that is attached to the tower and is fast spiralling down the courtyard below...and Draco!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Odolf, realizing Einon's dead, wheels on the chained drag and, grinning, utters a war-cry and charges with his spea But he suddenly hears something behind him. It is... BOWEN...riding the pulley~line down and swooping in on Od from behind. Odolf holds up his spear to block the descending axe. But the blade slices through the shaft an buries itself in Odolf's chest. A WAIL OF GRIEF AND OUTRA echoes from... THE BATTLEMENTS...where ORAM, having witnessed his brothe death, pulls his bow string taut. But before he can unlea his arrow, Draco's nostril shoots a SPRAY OF FLAME that engulfs the dragonslayer, the impact knocking him off the parapet with an agonizing scream, as..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: «+ehis body, a spiralling fireball, plummets down the wal and down the mountain.  108

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bowen pilfers the keys off Odolf's belt and starts to unl the shackles about Draco's neck. Draco stretches his neck

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: You should have let them do it. Now you must.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: What? Kara arrives in the courtyard from the tower, overhearing Draco.

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: Even as the heart binds Einon to me in life, it binds us in death.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: That is not true.

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: You've seen that it is. Through the heart we share each other's pains and power. But in my half beats the Life Source. For Einon to die, I must die.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: (refusing to believe) Einon is dead! Tell him, Kara! But Kara can't. She is uncertain. She knows what she's seen. But she also knows Draco.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: I...1...don't know...

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: You saw it!

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: He lives! Bowen is desperate.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter! {gestures to the battle noise) Don't you hear it? Our rebels...our silly, sorry little band of rebels have stormed the castle. Alive or dead, Einon's beaten. We've won!  109

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: You will never win until Einon's evil is destroyed. And to do that, you must destroy me!

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: Once you swore your sword and service were mine. To call when I had need of you. To ask what I would of you. I ask now! I need now. I hold you to your vow, Knight! Suddenly Draco's sixth sense picks up something. He wince ‘pain, hissing breathlessly.

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: He's coming! Coming to stop you! Bowen frantically whirls to the wreckage. But there is nothing. No one.

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: Strike before it's too late!

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: (torn) You're the last!

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: My time is over. Strike!

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: You're my friend!

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: Then as my friend, Strike! Please!

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: I can't! I can't send you soulless into Hell!

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: (snarling) Then I will make you! With a roar, Draco lunges at Bowen with his snapping fang Bowen evades the blow. Again, Draco lashes out, trying to provoke Bowen, but again the knight dodges the sharp teet

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: Fight back, Dragonslayer!  110 Once more, Draco dives at him with his flashing fangs. Bo leaps out of the shackled dragon's range. Rattling his chains wildly, Draco shoots a jet of flame at Bowen. Kara screams, but Bowen holds ground, as the flamess just miss

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: Defend yourself! Bowen flings the axe to the ground, near the wreckage of cistern. Draco shoots another bolt of fire. This one closer. Bowen recoils.

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: Pick it up! His chest heaves out ready to spew more fire.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: No! TI will do it! She runs for the axe. Bowen moves to stop her.

dialogues.speaker: BUT SOMEONE ELSE STOPS HER,
dialogues.text: EINON!...suddenly leaping up out of the wreckage of the cistern and scaffolding. Bloody and battered but very muc alive! Draco wails in misery. Einon grabs Kara by the arm and whirls her to him, sword blade at her throat. Bowen snatches up the axe and hoists back, aimed at Draco.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: Move and she dies! STALEMATE. Bowen freezes...until... DRACO...viciously sinks his fangs into his chained claw. But it is Einon who FEELS THE FANGS. In his sword hand. T blade clatters to the stone as he recoils...and... BOWEN...in that instant realizes WHAT HE MUST DO. He yank Kara from Einon's grasp and, shoving her to safety, spins around, back to Einon, and raises the axe to strike... DRACO...exposing his breast for the blow; his scales fall back, revealing his scar. But... EINON...is already pulling his knife from his belt to plu into Bowen's neck.

dialogues.speaker: EINON
dialogues.text: Only expose your back to a corpse! His blade comes down, but...  lil THE AXE...leaves Bowen's hand and, twirling in the air, buries itself in Draco's scarred breast. KARA...stifles a scream as... DRACO...reels. Suddenly his old wound SHIMMERS BRILLIANTL Then it FADES TO DULLNESS once more as Draco falls, his grateful eyes staring into the anxious face of... BOWEN...his own eyes flood with tears, wheeling on... EINON...who staggers, clutching his chest. His eyes fille with stunned disbelief. His mouth agape in a silent screa As he lunges forward, Bowen, sneering through tear-dimmed eyes, grabs Einon's upraised knife and folds it under, jamming the blade into Einon's chest. Momentum carries -king's body over the top of Bowen.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: You are a corpse. Einon flops down beside Draco and, with a strangled groan his eyes close. Just a brief second before Draco's own di and close, with one last GRATEFUL LOOK at... BOWEN...who sees Draco SMILE BEATIFICALLY as his eyelids flutter down. Going to his final rest with SERENE PEACE O SAINT. Bowen kneels forlornly over Draco's still body. Ka joins the vigil, oblivious to the ringing shouts of victo elsewhere in the castle. Hewe, Gilbert, and a vanguard of the rebels rush in and...seeing the dragon, their jubiliation is quickly for Gilbert joins his friends, crossing himself. The others e in solemn reverence for their dead comrade and their grie commander. They drift silently in from everywhere, fillin the courtyard and the battlements.

dialogues.speaker: BOWEN
dialogues.text: (anguished) What now, Dragon?! You abandon us alone in our freedom! Without you, what do we do? Where do we turn...?

dialogues.speaker: DRACO, (VO)
dialogues.text: To the stars, Bowen. To the stars... The VOICE is a whisper, warm and reassuring. Bowen turns Kara. She's also heard it. So has Gilbert. ALL HAVE HEARD IT. NONE WILL FORGET IT. Bowen turns back to...

dialogues.speaker: DRACO...AN EERIE, ETHEREAL GLOW OF TRANSLUCENT IRRIDESCEN
dialogues.text: oozes out of his wound like a strange, glowing mist cover his corpse. Then it spreads out over the ground. Draco's body dissolves in the mist, becomes one with it, as the strange glow begins to float upward. Past Bowen, Kara, an Gilbert, past...  112 THE REBELS...Their awed faces awash in the ethereal glow it rises above the castle walls and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...out into the night. The LIGHT swiftly swirls behind th mountains and suddenly the night becomes alive with CELES COLOUR...an AURORA BOREALIS OF FIREWORK FLASH. Then echoi on the air, comes DRACO'S DRAGONSONG, sweet, clear, and joyous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bowen gazes heavenward. Expectant. Waiting. Smiling. A -strange look on his face. A knowledge in his eye. A PERCEPTION. Gilbert and Kara wonder what he sees. If he's mad with grief. They look from him to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Light behind the mountains spins and concentrates a shimmering STREAK, lancing through the darkness. The st suddenly DIM, fading from the sky as the strange light sh across night's black curtain toward... THE CONSTELLATION DRACO...where the streak of light ERUPT into a BLAZING STAR whirling with dazzling splendour into formation, becoming the eye of the constellation. The whole constellation sparkles and, for an instant, A PROFILE OF DRACO, looms along the outline of the constellation. But just for an instant, then fading along with Draco's song as the other stars return to the heaven

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiling. Kara hugs Bowen. Gilbert crosses himself. All stare transfixed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The new star glitters brilliantly...more vivid, more lust than the others, its' gleaming rays beaming out to and do upon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOWEN...And Kara and Gilbert...their upturned faces bathe its glow. A trio of stillness amidst the raucous celebrat of their fellows. THE CAMERA PULLS BACK. UP. The noise grows dimmer. And the light that frames them grows more intense.  113 AND THE CAMERA CONTINUES BACK.

dialogues.speaker: GILBERT, (VO)
dialogues.text: This is the tale of a Knight who slew a dragon and vanquished evil. The three look very small now. Seen from above. As all things must look from Heaven. All that keeps them from blending into the rest of the surging mass is the beam of starshine that falls down upon them. Smiles upon them. An seems to gleam ever brighter. And brighter. Until the dar is swept away and all is...

dialogues.speaker: EXQUISITE LIGHT
dialogues.text: ‘FADE OUT.
